intro: Prockia lutea, commonly known as the yellow prockia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of hair. Prockia lutea thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy addition to gardens. It is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
